dmca.title: [ABUSE] Copyright Abuse
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Friday, February 03, 2006 9:08 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Copyright Abuse

This message was received at abuse@theplanet.com on Friday, February 03,
2006 at 2:13:20 AM and concerns a matter for which responsibility is
delegated to your team. The message and headers follow.

Thank you,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

SUBJECT:
[ABUSE] Copyright Abuse

MESSAGE BODY:
I'm writing this E-Mail on behalf of someone who can't too well do it on
their own due to English not being their first language.

According to Whois info I tried to look up, I believe your company is the
host of the site of this IP address: 70.84.157.52.

This site runs a webforum which is breaking copyright by keeping stored and
available freely for download various works, as well as small self made
computer games that are made by the person I'm helping to send this message.
Posts on his forum requesting he remove the copyrighted works as well as
E-Mails to the admin all go unanswered.
The user account and IP of the person whose works are still on this webforum
are banned and he can no longer access the webforum.

The owner of the site has a splash page at the beginning of the site however
trying to claim that just by entering the site and posting something that
the person posting something must be the copyright owner of the things they
post, and also seems to assume they are, and as well insist that he can take
control and ownership of any copyrighted material which is posted to his
disgusting forum. As said above every possible way of communicating with him
to remove the content that isn't his are totally ignored.

The person whose work is on the site and was blocked from entering it, as
well as being ignored in his requests for his things to be removed, while I
don't have the exact username he used, he was going by the nickname
"Markie". This should help so the site owner will know which situation you
are referring to when he is contacted about this.


RFC822 HEADERS:
